text: Rory W. McTurk is a British philologist. McTurk graduated from Oxford University in 1963. He took a further degree at the University of Iceland in 1965, and subsequently taught at Lund University, the University of Copenhagen, and University College Dublin. He took up a post at the University of Leeds in 1978, where he has gained the position of Professor Emeritus of Icelandic Studies. McTurk has authored, edited and translated many works on Icelandic literature. He is a recipient of the Order of the Falcon. ==Selected bibliography== * Studies in Ragnars Saga Loðbrókar and its Major Scandinavian Analogues, 1991 * Chaucer and the Norse and Celtic Worlds, 2005 ==References== Category:Academics of University College Dublin Category:Academics of the University of Leeds Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:British philologists Category:Living people Category:Lund University faculty Category:Old Norse studies scholars Category:Recipients of the Order of the Falcon Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:University of Copenhagen faculty Category:University of Iceland alumni
title: Rory McTurk
